chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly K Heine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL NOTES: AFT applied remaning atty fee added to case 15CF347
Order for payment of Atty.Witt as appointed defense counsel covering cases 14CF263 and 15CF347 in the amount of $528.25 . Assessment is added to case 15CF347.
Cover letter for Petition for Payment of Legal Fees and Proposed Order for Payment
Proposed Order for Payment of Legal Fees in the amount of $528.25 submitted by Attorney Witt
with attachments for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Witt  in the amount of $528.25 .

It is hereby Stipulated and agreed by and between the parties to this action, by their undersigned attorneys, that the Judgemtn of Conviction should be amended to reflect the charging statue as 943.21(1m)(a). The referenced stipulation of the parties is hereby adopted as the Order of this Court.
Proposed Stipulation and Order Amend Judgment of Conviction
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF347 and 14CF263 called together at 9:32am [mo]
Defendant Kimberly K Heine in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
DA Happ submits Victim Restitution Form and Victim Impact Statement

Constitutional rights reviewed;factual basis stipulated
recess: 9:44am-- reconvene: 9:45am

DA Happ submits Amended Information for Case 14CF263
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
-- arguments given in support of amendments given by DA Happ
--the Court grants leave of the State to file the Amended Information

DA Happ orally motions to amend the charge in 15CF347 to a violation of 943.21(1m), a Class A misdemeanor, as portrayed in CCS; gives basis
--The Court grants the motion to amend the charge in 15CF347

Pleas of " No Contest " entered on Amended Counts #1 and #2 of Case 14CF263 and Amended charge in Case 15CF347;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Case 14CF263, Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions as listed below.
On Case 15CF347, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as listed below

Conditions of Probation for Case 14CF263 and 15CF347:
--Complete a Financial Responsibility class, per Agent
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Nancy Emmons, Bill Ingersoll or Kami Warren
--repayment of attorney fees after Atty. Witt submitts final billing
--On Case 14CF263: to pay restitution in the amount of $1297.34 to Sullivan EMS
--On Case 14CF263: to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--On Case 14CF263: to pay $86 in subpoena fees
--On Case 14CF263, Amended Count #1: the Court orders statutory costs
--On Case 14CF263. Amended Count #2: the Court orders statutory costs
--On Case 15CF347, Amended Count #1: the Court orders statutory costs


Days credit for time already served:  0 days

The Court does not order a DNA sample due to DOV
recess:10:15am
Status conference at 02-16-2016 09:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-13-2016 08:20 am
Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:24pm [mo]
Defendant Kimberly K Heine in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant verifies date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint

The Court discloses that it knows a person listed in the Criminal Complaint, does not feel any recusal is needed. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Jefferson High School; except to attend Conferences or Meetings regarding her children
--no contact with witnesses; Craig Gerlach, Mark Rollefson, Don Turner and Sarah Whitley, except to communicate regarding any issue a parent may need to talk to a school official about
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess: 2:34pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/13/16 at 8:20am   (2) Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 9:30am
Consent to Act as appointed attorney signed by Attorney Witt
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Attorney Witt
Court orders reimbursement of $75 per month first payment due on 12/9/15 (1 payment for both cases as a total of $75)
